subject: Business
title: Personalization: The Filter Bubble Effect
description: Learn Personalization: The Filter Bubble Effect in one minute.

hook.text: You search for running shoes once. Now every website shows you running shoe ads for the next month.

buildup.text: Personalization algorithms track behavior to show you what you're most likely to click on.

discovery.text: This increases conversions dramatically. Amazon attributes 35% of revenue to its recommendation engine.

twist.text: But personalization creates filter bubbles. You only see what the algorithm thinks you want. Choice narrows.

climax.text: The ethical balance: personalize enough to be helpful, not so much that customers feel surveilled.

punchline.text: When the ad knows too much, the customer feels watched, not helped.

quiz.question: What percentage of Amazon's revenue comes from its recommendation engine?
